intro: Clidemia naevula, commonly known as the silverleaf or velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant has velvety, hairy leaves that give it its common name, and it often grows in moist, shaded environments. Clidemia naevula is an evergreen shrub that can reach heights of up to two meters. It is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and flowers.
